Allocating Items During Sales Order Processing In Acumatica ERP, you can reserve stock when you enter sales orders so that the items promised to a customer cannot be shipped to another customer. With a sales order of the SA type (that is, a sales order with allocations), the system allocates the item quantity on the sales order automatically once the sales order is saved. If you want to allocate the items of an existing regular sales order of the SO type, or you want to allocate the items of a sales order partially, you need to perform the steps described in this guide. 1. Create a Sales Order On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you create a sales order of the SO type, and fill in the Document Details tab with the ordered items. You can also allocate the items of an existing SO sales order with the On Hold or Open status. 2. Allocate the Quantity of an Item On the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you click the line for which you are going to allocate a quantity of the item, and on the table toolbar, you click Allocations . The Allocations dialog box opens. In the dialog box, you select the Allocated check box, and click OK to close the dialog box. This quantity will be allocated when you save your changes to the sales order. During the allocation of an item that has an insufficient Available quantity at the warehouse the item is sold from, the system splits the allocated line in the Allocations dialog box to allocate all the Available quantity and leave the remaining quantity unallocated in the second line. 3. Optional: Allocate an Item That Is Tracked by Lot or Serial Number When an item that is tracked by lot or serial number is allocated, you can select the lot or serial number in the Lot/Serial Nbr. box of the Allocations dialog box. Alternatively, you can leave this box blank and select lot or serial number when you process the shipment for the sales order. If a lot or serial number has been selected on allocation, when you process the shipment for the sales order, you can change the lot or serial number, if needed. 4. Optional: Allocate an Item at Another Warehouse You can also allocate an item at a different warehouse than the one the item is sold from—for example, if the item has no Available quantity at the warehouse—by changing the warehouse in the Alloc. Warehouse box of the Allocations dialog box. The quantities allocated at another warehouse need to be transferred to the warehouse the item was sold from before the item is shipped to the customer. For details, see Sale with Transferred Stock Items. 5. Save the Sales Order To allocate the items, you save your changes to the sales order. To Create a Sales Order with Allocations (SA)

Fulfilling Sales Orders by Using Transfer Orders In Acumatica ERP, you can fulfill a sales order even if some of the items on the sales order have no Available quantity at the warehouse. You can allocate these items at a warehouse that differs from the warehouse of the sales order and then transfer the allocated items to fulfill the sales order, as described in this guide. 1. Create a Sales Order On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you create a sales order of the SO type and fill in the Document Details tab with the ordered items. If some items have no Available quantity at the warehouse of the sales order line, as shown in the following screenshot with LAPTOP12 , you can allocate them at another warehouse. You can select Ship Complete as the Shipping Rule of each sales order line if you want to ship the sales order only if the full quantity of all the sales order lines is available for shipping at the warehouse specified in the lines. You can predefine each customer's default shipping rule for sales orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=AR303000|AR303000]) Customers (AR303000) form. For details, see To Create a Sales Order (SO). 2. Allocate the Unavailable Quantities of the Sales Order Lines On the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you allocate the items that have insufficient Available quantity at the warehouse. In the Allocations dialog box (as the screenshot below shows), you select the Allocated check box and an Alloc. Warehouse that differs from the warehouse of the sales order line and for which the item has a sufficient Available quantity. When you save the sales order with the Open status (that is, with the Hold check box cleared), the system generates transfer requests for each line of the sales order for which the item has been allocated in a warehouse other than the warehouse selected in the line. For details, see To Reserve an Inventory Item for an Order. 3. Create the Transfer Order On the toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you click Actions Create Transfer Order to create transfer orders. On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO509000|SO509000]) Create Transfer Orders (SO509000) form, which opens, you process the transfer requests of the sales order (see the following screenshot). You can also create transfer orders for multiple sales orders if the Order Type and Order Nbr. are cleared on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO509000|SO509000]) Create Transfer Orders (SO509000) form. The system creates a consolidated transfer order, which is a sales order of the TR type, for each group of transfer requests that have both the same source warehouse ( From Warehouse ) and the same destination warehouse ( To Warehouse ). The date of the created transfer orders is that specified in the Creation Date box. If you want to ship the transfer order only in full, you can select Ship Complete as the Shipping Rule of each transfer order line to avoid a partial shipment. You can predefine each branch's default shipping rule for transfer orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS102000|CS102000]) Branches (CS102000) form. For details, see To Create a Transfer Order (TR). 4. Create the Shipment for the Transfer Order On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO301000|SO301000]) Sales Orders (SO301000) form, you create the shipment for each transfer order (that is, sales order of the TR type) that has been created, as the following screenshot shows. You can also create shipments for multiple transfer orders on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO501000|SO501000]) Process Orders (SO501000) form by selecting the Create Shipment action and processing the needed orders. For details, see To Create a Shipment for an Order. 5. Process the Shipment On the ([~/?ScreenId=SO302000|SO302000]) Shipments (SO302000) form, by selecting the appropriate actions on the form toolbar, you confirm each shipment that has been created and update the inventory to issue the items, as the following screenshot shows. You can also process multiple shipments at once on the ([~/?ScreenId=SO503000|SO503000]) Process Shipments (SO503000) form. For details, see To Confirm a Shipment. 6. Create and Process the Transfer Receipts for the Shipment On the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form, you create a receipt of the Transfer Receipt type, as the screenshot below shows. In the Warehouse box in the Summary area, you select the warehouse of the sales order, which will receive the transfer order. You then release the transfer receipt, which causes the inventory receipt to be created. When this inventory receipt is released, the system counts the items that have been transferred to the sales order as available. You can also receive multiple transfer orders with one transfer receipt.
